ai.summary: A 14.4 km moderate-grade hike in the UK called Avenue. The route blends country lanes, woodland paths, and open stretches, delivering a relaxed yet engaging half-day walk suited to walkers with moderate fitness. It does not emphasize any particular theme or motif.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain: grassy trails, woodland track, and occasional tarmac sections. Moderate elevation changes with a few gentle climbs; expect muddy sections after rain and occasional roots or loose gravel. Navigation relies on waymarkers and local landmarks; map or GPS recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for daylight and weather; wear sturdy boots; stay on official paths; be cautious of vehicles on country lanes; carry a map/compass or GPS; tell someone your route and expected return; bring water and snacks; check for closures and local advisories before starting.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; particularly pleasant from April to October; conditions can vary in UK, so be prepared for mud and rain year-round.

seo.title: Avenue Hike - 14.4 km Moderate Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Avenue, a 14.4 km moderate hike in the UK. Learn about the terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and gear to enjoy a comfortable day on the trail.
